invariants amongst SALT,OPENED_KEY,CLOSED in METADATA.

Add get_metadata() to return info, including the state.

Add comments to clarify that SALT columns should never be returned.

heh. wrong help. fix py-based schema loading.

Add line/branch coverage testing.

In Python, one of the major classes of errors (since no compilation
step exists) is simple typos of identifiers. Running coverage to
verify that each line is touched finds 99% of these typos.

This adds a simple test to run coverage over the "steve" package, and
achieves 100% for the primary package, but 0% of the "steve.vtypes"
subpackage (but will, shortly).

show how to add schema via python

nit: single quotes are fine here
no need for arg. pull from DB.

Run STV through the v3 path.

The v3 code loads stv_tool, and this new script runs the voting
through that loading mechanism.

Future work will use the v3 tally() function, but this helps to sketch
out testing/comparison with more of the v3 apparatus.

pattern for this code.

Accept a salt for opened_key creation.

Like the recent change for token creation, the opened_key sometimes
needs to be re-computed with the prior salt to get the same value, in
order to detect tampering of the election data. Thus, take the salt as
a parameter, rather than internal creation and return.

Only record row-factories for certain cursors. For any other cursor,
just return the row as-provided. This simplifies add_statement() and
allows for the application to create cursors outside our purview.
